item.title: Increasing the WordPress Memory Limit
item.dc:creator: Kevin
item.description:
Edit your wp-config.php file and enter something like: NOTE:  WordPress memory can be different to the server – you need to set this regardless of server memory settings. http://codex.wordpress.org/Editing_wp-config.php#Increasing_memory_allocated_to_PHP If you have access to your PHP.ini file, change the line in PHP.iniIf your line shows 32M try 64M: If you don’t have access to PHP.ini […]

The post Increasing the WordPress Memory Limit appeared first on Redux Documentation.
item.content:encoded:
1. Edit your wp-config.php file and enter something like: 
    define('WP_MEMORY_LIMIT', '96M');

    NOTE:  WordPress memory can be different to the server – you need to set this regardless of server memory settings.

    http://codex.wordpress.org/Editing_wp-config.php#Increasing_memory_allocated_to_PHP

  2. If you have access to your PHP.ini file, change the line in PHP.ini

    If your line shows 32M try 64M: 

    memory_limit = 64M ; Maximum amount of memory a script may consume (64MB)
  3. If you don’t have access to PHP.ini try adding this to an .htaccess file: 

    php_value memory_limit 64M
  4. If none of the above works then talk to your host.

The post Increasing the WordPress Memory Limit appeared first on Redux Documentation.
